definitions: natural process by which the body repairs itself after injury or illness
act or practice of using various methods to restore physical or emotional health
examples: The healing of the wound took several weeks
Proper rest and nutrition are essential for healing
She studied healing techniques from different cultures
The center offers various forms of healing therapy

definitions: organized provision of medical care to individuals or communities through professional services
examples: Healthcare costs continue to rise each year
She works in healthcare management for a large hospital
Universal healthcare provides medical services to all citizens
The healthcare industry employs millions of workers worldwide

definitions: untidy collection of objects placed on top of each other
informal term for a very large quantity or number of something
examples: A heap of dirty laundry sat in the corner
She swept the leaves into a neat heap
We have heaps of work to finish today
There were heaps of people at the concert

definitions: information received from others that cannot be adequately substantiated or verified as true
examples: The rumors were based on hearsay rather than facts
Hearsay evidence is generally not admissible in court
Don't believe everything you hear; it might be hearsay
The newspaper article relied too heavily on hearsay

definitions: specially designed vehicle for transporting a coffin or casket to a funeral or cemetery
examples: The black hearse led the funeral procession slowly
A flower-covered hearse carried the coffin to the cemetery
The funeral director arranged for the hearse to arrive
Several cars followed behind the hearse in the procession

definitions: deep emotional distress or grief typically caused by loss or disappointment in love
examples: The breakup caused her terrible heartache for months
He couldn't hide the heartache in his eyes
Parents endure heartache when their children move away
The song captured the heartache of lost love perfectly

definitions: rhythmic contraction and expansion of the heart pumping blood through the body
very short period of time or instant
examples: The doctor listened to her heartbeat with a stethoscope
His heartbeat quickened when he saw her enter
She would return in a heartbeat if asked
The decision was made in a heartbeat without hesitation

definitions: overwhelming distress or grief caused by loss of love or deep disappointment
examples: The heartbreak from their divorce lasted for years
She wrote poetry to cope with her heartbreak
First heartbreak is often the most difficult to overcome
His heartbreak was evident in every song he performed

definitions: person who is attractive but causes emotional pain by ending romantic relationships carelessly
examples: Everyone warned her that he was a heartbreaker
The notorious heartbreaker left many broken relationships behind
She gained a reputation as a heartbreaker in college
That heartbreaker has dated half the people in town

definitions: floor of a fireplace usually made of stone or brick
symbolic center of the home representing warmth and family life
examples: She swept the ashes from the hearth every morning
The cat loved sleeping near the warm hearth
They gathered around the hearth to share family stories
The hearth represents the heart of traditional home life

definitions: central or most important part of a country or area often considered culturally significant
examples: The American heartland produces much of the nation's food
Small towns dot the heartland of the country
Politicians often campaign heavily in the heartland states
The heartland values of hard work remain strong

definitions: device that produces heat to warm a room, water, or other substances
examples: The space heater kept the bedroom warm all night
We need to replace the water heater soon
Turn on the heater; it's freezing in here
The car heater takes a few minutes to work

definitions: area of open uncultivated land typically covered with heather and low shrubs
examples: Wild ponies roam freely across the heath
The purple heather covered the heath in autumn
They took long walks across the windswept heath
The heath provides habitat for many bird species

definitions: person who does not belong to a widely held religion especially Christianity
person regarded as lacking culture or moral principles
examples: Missionaries sought to convert the heathens to Christianity
The term heathen is considered offensive by many today
He jokingly called his messy roommate a heathen
Don't act like a heathen at the dinner table

definitions: low-growing evergreen shrub with small purple, pink, or white flowers common on moorland
examples: The hillside was covered in blooming purple heather
Heather honey has a distinctive dark color and taste
Scottish landscapes often feature vast fields of heather
She picked a sprig of heather for good luck

definitions: system or process of supplying heat to a building or space to maintain comfortable temperature
examples: The heating bill was expensive during the cold winter
Central heating keeps the entire house warm
They installed solar heating to reduce energy costs
The heating system needs annual maintenance

definitions: great effort to lift or move something heavy
upward or outward movement especially of the chest when breathing heavily
examples: With a mighty heave, they lifted the boulder
It took several heaves to move the furniture
She felt the heave of the ship on rough seas
His chest rose with each labored heave

definitions: boxer competing in the heaviest weight division typically over 200 pounds
person of considerable importance or influence in a particular field
examples: The heavyweight champion defended his title successfully
Two heavyweights will fight for the championship tonight
She's a heavyweight in the technology industry
Political heavyweights attended the important summit meeting

definitions: person who interrupts a performer or public speaker with derisive or aggressive comments
examples: Security removed the heckler from the comedy show
The politician remained calm despite several hecklers
A persistent heckler disrupted the entire presentation
Stand-up comedians often deal with drunk hecklers

definitions: act of interrupting a public speaker or performer with loud, unfriendly comments or questions
examples: The heckling from the crowd made it hard to continue
Constant heckling forced the speaker to end early
Security warned against any heckling during the speech
The comedian turned the heckling into part of his act

definitions: metric unit of area equal to 10,000 square meters or about 2.47 acres
examples: The farm covers fifty hectares of fertile land
Each hectare can produce several tons of wheat
Forest fires destroyed thousands of hectares last summer
They bought ten hectares for their vineyard

definitions: fence or boundary formed by closely growing bushes or shrubs
way of protecting oneself against financial loss or other adverse circumstances
examples: The tall hedge provides privacy from the neighbors
He trimmed the hedge into a perfect rectangle
Buying gold is a hedge against inflation
She hedged her bets by applying to several colleges

definitions: small nocturnal mammal with a coat of sharp spines for protection
examples: The hedgehog curled into a ball when threatened
A hedgehog visited our garden every night
European hedgehogs hibernate during the winter months
Children love the cute appearance of hedgehogs

definitions: avoiding giving a direct answer or making a clear decision
financial strategy to reduce risk of adverse price movements in assets
examples: His constant hedging frustrated those seeking clear answers
Stop hedging and tell us what you really think
Portfolio hedging protects against market downturns
Currency hedging reduces foreign exchange risks

definitions: belief that pleasure or happiness is the highest good and proper aim of human life
examples: His lifestyle of hedonism eventually left him feeling empty
Ancient Greek philosophers debated the merits of hedonism
The resort catered to guests seeking hedonism and luxury
Critics accused them of promoting hedonism over responsibility

definitions: careful attention or consideration given to someone or something important
examples: Pay heed to the warning signs along the trail
She took heed of her doctor's advice immediately
Workers must give heed to all safety regulations
He failed to heed the repeated warnings

definitions: weight or heaviness of something, especially as a sign of quality or importance
examples: The sword had considerable heft in his hand
You can feel the heft of this quality leather
The book's intellectual heft impressed the critics
She tested the heft of each melon before buying

definitions: leadership or dominance of one country, group, or entity over others in political or cultural spheres
examples: The empire maintained hegemony over neighboring territories for centuries
Corporate hegemony threatens small business competition
Cultural hegemony shapes how societies view the world
They challenged the hegemony of traditional media companies

definitions: young female cow that has not yet had a calf
examples: The farmer bought several heifers to expand the herd
A heifer typically has her first calf at two years
The prize heifer won first place at the fair
Heifers grazed peacefully in the meadow

definitions: person legally entitled to receive property, rank, or title from someone after their death
examples: The eldest son was heir to the family fortune
She named her niece as heir in her will
The heir apparent prepared to assume the throne
Multiple heirs disputed the inheritance in court

definitions: valuable object that has belonged to a family for several generations
examples: Her grandmother's pearl necklace was a precious heirloom
The antique clock is a family heirloom
Heirloom tomatoes have seeds passed down through generations
She treasured the heirloom quilt made by her great-grandmother

definitions: carefully planned theft, especially of valuable items from a bank or business
examples: The bank heist made headlines across the country
Police investigated the jewelry store heist for months
The movie depicted an elaborate casino heist
The art heist remained unsolved for decades

definitions: designated area or platform for helicopters to take off and land
examples: The hospital heliport allows quick emergency patient transport
A private heliport sat atop the corporate headquarters
Weather conditions closed the mountain rescue heliport
The yacht featured its own heliport on deck

definitions: colorless, odorless inert gas that is lighter than air, used in balloons and as a coolant
examples: Party balloons were filled with helium to float
Helium makes your voice sound high and squeaky
Scientists use liquid helium for cooling superconductors
The world faces a potential helium shortage

definitions: three-dimensional spiral curve, like a corkscrew or the structure of DNA
examples: DNA forms a double helix structure in cells
The staircase rose in a perfect helix
The helix shape appears throughout nature
Scientists studied the protein's helix configuration

definitions: fire of hell as described in religious texts, representing eternal punishment or damnation
examples: The preacher warned of hellfire for unrepentant sinners
Medieval paintings depicted souls burning in hellfire
He delivered a hellfire and brimstone sermon
Fear of hellfire motivated religious conversion

definitions: word used as a greeting or to begin a phone conversation
examples: She said hello to everyone entering the store
Hello, is anyone home?
Answer the phone with a friendly hello
A simple hello can brighten someone's day

definitions: wheel or tiller used to steer a ship or boat
position of leadership or control in an organization
examples: The captain gripped the helm during the storm
An experienced sailor took the helm
She assumed the helm of the company last year
With new leadership at the helm, profits increased

definitions: person who steers a ship or boat, especially the assigned crew member
examples: The helmsman kept the ship on course through fog
An experienced helmsman navigated the dangerous waters
The racing yacht needs a skilled helmsman
The helmsman responded quickly to the captain's orders

definitions: person who helps someone else with tasks or provides assistance
examples: Santa's helpers work hard making toys for Christmas
She hired a helper for the busy holiday season
The teacher assigned classroom helpers each week
Volunteer helpers distributed food at the shelter

definitions: portion or serving of food given to one person at a meal
examples: Would you like a second helping of dessert?
She served generous helpings to all the guests
The child asked for another helping of mashed potatoes
One helping of vegetables isn't enough for growing children

definitions: edge of a piece of cloth or clothing that has been turned under and sewn
examples: The hem of her dress needed to be shortened
He caught his foot in the hem of the curtain
She carefully stitched the hem by hand
The hem came undone after several washes

definitions: branch of medicine concerned with the study of blood, blood-forming organs, and blood diseases
examples: She specialized in pediatric hematology at the hospital
Hematology tests revealed an iron deficiency
The hematology department handles all blood-related conditions
Advanced hematology research focuses on cancer treatments
